title: EU agrees on landmark law to curb Big Tech giants dominance - regulations on Google, Meta, Amazon, Apple, etc. - Times Now
content:
1. EU agrees on landmark law to curb Big Tech giants dominance - regulations on Google, Meta, Amazon, Apple, etc.  Times Now
  2. US tech giants face tough new rules as EU countries, lawmakers clinch deal  Economic Times
  3. EU reaches agreement on rules to rein in Google, Meta, other tech giants  Business Standard
  4. EU approves controversial new DMA law putting clamps on big tech  The Indian Express
  5. Analysis: New EU rules regulating U.S. tech giants likely to set global standard  Reuters
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: Meeting in Brussels the lawmakers nailed down a long list of do's and don'ts that will single out the world's most iconic web giants as internet "gatekeepers" subject to special rules. The rules could come into place starting on January 1, 2023, though tech companies are asking for more time to implement the law.
